message: a review of open-source static site generators, comparing features, licenses and templates.
story: Mohamed Alaa El Din shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: StaticGen
caption: staticgen.com
description: StaticGen is a leaderboard of the top open-source static site generators. Promoting a static approach to building websites.

data.message: I only used Jekyll for my blog and I LOVE IT
Ahmad, is there a specific reason why you like Jekyll? I am interested in using a static site generator and would prefer a personal opinion to a simple matrix comparison.

Ahmad Alfy ممكن اشوف شكل البلوج ؟ اصل عايز اعمل بلوج بس لحاجات بسيطة مثلا حاجة معينة في كود عندي مش عارفها و حلتها اعمل بيها بوست و كدة تبقي كمرجع ليا او لو حد احتاجه لنفس المشكلة , بس مش عارف استخدم بلوج علي ايه و هل اقدر اضيف screenshots لو هحتاجها و كدة ؟

واضح ان octopress كويس :D 
دا حسب كلام الdocumentation بتاعتهم
Will share details when I get home :)

Opinion below is mine. YMMV

I use static site generator because I already write my thoughts since 2004 in plain text files. I can write on any device & editor. I use Sublime these days, but I used Notepad++ before & I still use it for Arabic notes. I can write even if I'm offline or using my mobile. I can sync with dropbox or any other program.

The other good thing about it is control. My first blog was hosted on my employer's website, but they system they used was shit! I started using Wordpress on my own website, but I got warning from my host that my WP installation was not secure. 

Finally, I moved to Pelican. I used it because it's Python. It's not great, but it get's better. In the past weeks I've been working on changing my blog to be more like a tumblr, allowing shorter posts without title. Pelican didn't show any problems during this transition.

I suggest you play with the most popular & choose what you like.

I used Octopress and Pelican. Octopress is more mature than Pelican, but is a lot slower and its local server for preview is not the best experience you can have. I like Pelican because it is fast, and because it is written in Python.

My website currently uses Pelican hosted on Dreamhost.
